list_definition.definition: one who gives amusing performances professionally

list_ex_of_english: If they are to be successful, entertainers must meet the needs, the dreams and the fantasies of a better life that entertainment gives us.
The actors not only double up to play different parts, but also perform different roles as entertainers, musicians, and storytellers.
Any success depended on entertaining whatever audiences were available, at juke joints, house parties and as a street entertainer.
The streets, traditionally the domain of the poor, were more strictly policed and neighbourhood festivities banned while efforts were made to regulate the activities of street entertainers.
Jeliw are much more than entertainers.
There were also circuses with comedians and entertainers for the children.
They were entertainers first, commentators second or third.
In contrast, late 1990s television turned live performance into the reality show with its focus on a small group of 'ordinary' people presented as the opposite of professional entertainers.
